thread.title: Here’s what Twitter thinks of the NFL’s first woman coach
thread.title_full: Here’s what Twitter thinks of the NFL’s first woman coach - MarketWatch

author: By     Victor Reklaitis
title: Here’s what Twitter thinks of the NFL’s first woman coach
text:
www.jenwelter.com Jen Welter The NFL on Tuesday is enjoying a bit of feel-good news tied to breaking through barriers, offsetting recent bad publicity from the “Deflategate” scandal , pricey stadiums and other problems .
The pro football league’s Arizona Cardinals late Monday announced a new coach, Jen Welter, saying she’s “believed to be the first woman to hold a coaching position of any kind in the NFL.”
Here’s a celebratory tweet from the team with a photo of Welter:
She has a Master’s.
She has a PhD.
She has an #AZCardinals coaching job.
She is @jwelter47 . http://t.co/eQu8HUHKBo pic.twitter.com/GaU7dTTNUj
— Arizona Cardinals (@AZCardinals) July 28, 2015 She will serve as a “training camp/preseason intern coaching inside linebackers,” the team said. An Arizona Republic report said Welter’s “tenure in 2015 will be short, but meaningful .”
Who is Welter and what’s her football experience? The 37-year-old played professional football for more than 14 years in women’s leagues, helping the Dallas Diamonds of the Women’s Football Alliance win four titles, according to an ESPN report.
She already has at least one other “first” under her belt. She was the first woman to play a non-kicking position in a men’s pro football league when she suited up last year as a running back and special-teams player for the Texas Revolution of the Indoor Football League, ESPN notes.
The Revolution then hired her in February to coach linebackers and special teams. She holds master’s and doctoral degrees in psychology and played rugby at Boston College. Her move to the Cardinals comes roughly three months after the NFL hired its first female full-time game official .
Many Twitter users are enthusiastic about Welter scoring this NFL gig, with some suggesting this was hard to imagine decades ago:
I teared up at the news of #AZCardinals hiring new coach @JWelter47 .
Doors r opening that #ICouldOnlyDreamOfAsAKid https://t.co/buDVPCj31d
— TonjaTriplett (@TonjaTriplett) July 28, 2015 Others see the hiring as an inspiration:
@jwelter47 great to hear of your appointment at the Cardinals - no doubt inspiring many women and girls across the football world.
— American Football (@LAAF2015) July 28, 2015 But there are also plenty of skeptics, and here's an example of a PG-rated tweet:
@AdamSchefter lol, girls can't coach NFL players, this is just dumb. Good luck AZ! #PublicityStunt
— Thomas seitz (@TRaySeitz) July 28, 2015 More from MarketWatch
